title.rendered: Applying to Osteopathic Medical College – AACOMAS Requirements and Guides

content.rendered:
AACOMAS Requirements and Guides – The AACOMAS of the Osteopathic Medical College Application portal is currently open. Qualified applicant should use the AACOMAS application portal to apply for admission. To apply, kindly follow this link.

American Association of Colleges of Osteopathic Medicine AACOMAS Application Form 2024

Applying to Osteopathic Medical College 2024 – AACOMAS Requirements and Guides

Applying to the osteopathic medical College 2024 is highly competitive and required good grade points and proper documents submission to meet with the competitive admission criteria.

Contents

Applying to Osteopathic Medical College 2024 – AACOMAS Requirements and Guides

AACOM Mean Grade Point Averages (GPA) for Entering Students

Medical College Admission Test (MCAT)

Good Personal Qualities

Previous Academic/Education background

AACOMAS Letter of Recommendation

How to Apply for Osteopathic Medical Schools

AACOMAS Personal Statement

When Is It Too Late to Apply to Osteopathic Schools

As a prospective students of osteopathic Medical School, you are required to follow the steps below apply for admission and stand a better chance of being admitted into the college.

To be qualified for admission into the Medical College, Prospective students must possess;

  • Good Mean Grade Point Averages
  • Medical College Admission Test (MCAT)
  • Good Personal Qualities
  • In-State Vs Out-of-State
  • Letters of Recommendation
  • Zero Criminal Background Checks.

AACOM Mean Grade Point Averages (GPA) for Entering Students

The AACOM osteopathic Medical College required the following Grade Point Averages for admission consideration.

GPA/year 2024 2019 2024 2024
Science 3.43 3.51 3.54 3.51
Non-Science 3.65 3.67 3.64 3.69
Overall GPA 3.53 3.57 3.54 3.59

 

Medical College Admission Test (MCAT)

The table below shows the required medical College Admission Test Score for admission eligibility.

MCAT/year 2024 2019 2024 2024
Psychological, Social, & Bio 126.5 126.78 126.92 127.14
Bio. & Biochemical 126.2 126.26 126.29 126.47
Chemical & Physical 125.8 125.9 125.89 125.97
Critical Analysis & Reasoning 125.4 125.32 125.20 125.31
TOTAL MCAT 503.1 504.25 504.31 504.89

Good Personal Qualities

At Osteopathic medical schools, good inter-personal qualities are also required for admission consideration. These includes;

  • Motivation to pursue a career in osteopathic medicine
  • Well-rounded
  • Diverse backgrounds knowledge
  • Demonstrate strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Good record of Community Service
  • Good record of Leadership
  • Participation in a variety of Extracurricular Activities
  • Have shadowed an osteopathic physician
  • Have some Clinical experience
  • Possess knowledge of Osteopathic Medicine

Previous Academic/Education background

Prospective student is also accessed by their academic background to the course applied to. In general, courses considered for Medical colleges includes,

  • One year of biology
  • One year of physics
  • One year of English composition
  • Two years of chemistry

Sometimes, some schools give their criteria. There is still hope for you.

AACOMAS Letter of Recommendation

All medical schools require letters of evaluation/recommendation. A letter of Evaluation/Recommendation are letters written about a student to be accessed or evaluated in any college(s) based on their competencies and performance. These includes Service Orientation, Social Skills, Cultural Competence, Teamwork, Oral Communication, Ethical Responsibility to Self and Others, Reliability and Dependability, Resilience and Adaptability, Capacity for Improvement, Critical Thinking, Quantitative Reasoning, Scientific Inquiry, Written Communication, Living Systems, and, Human Behavior. These letters are written by Professor(s) of Science, Professor(s) in your Major, Professor(s) or a Supervisor from a Clinical Experience, Research Experience Supervisor(s).

Note: These letters must be submitted to your college through the AACOMAS application or directly to the schools using alternative services indicated by each school in the college information section of this book.

Alternative route to submitting your letter of recommendation are; Interfolio, VirtualEvals, and, U.S. Mail

How to Apply for Osteopathic Medical Schools

The application for admission into various medical colleges is done through the American Association of Colleges of Osteopathic Medicine Application Service (AACOMAS) portal. The AACOMAS is the centralized application service for U.S. osteopathic medical schools.

To apply,

  • Visit https://aacomas.liaisoncas.com
  • Login with Username and password.
  • Fill and submit all required forms online.
  • Pay all application fees
  • Submit all academic documents
  • Submit letter of Recommendation
  • Submit personal statement

AACOMAS Personal Statement

Endeavour to write AACOMAS Personal Statement about the career in osteopathic Medicine, submit same to the appropriate offices.

When Is It Too Late to Apply to Osteopathic Schools

Application deadline for different medical colleges differs. Ensure to visit the desired colleges to find appropriate deadline before applying.
